data.title: Sir Andrew Huxley, OM, FRS, Nobel Laureate, in interview with Max Blythe. Interview 2, parts 1 & 2.
data.meta_description: Jodrell Professor, 1960-69; Royal Society Research Professor, 1969-83, University College London. Master of Trinity College Cambridge, 1984-90; President of the Royal Society, 1980-85. Awarded Nobel Prize for Physiology and Medicine in 1963, for work on nerve action.
